page two
Dr. Jones
July 18, 1968
questionnaires to all educational radio and tele¬
vision stations requesting detailed outlines of their
programming efforts for and about the underprivileged.
A number of exciting program descriptions have already
been returned to us. Plans are to publish a weekly
bulletin which will describe present and proposed
projects in this field. Ken informs me that he plans
to mail the first of these bulletins early next week.
I am requesting him to put you on this mailing list so
that you will be kept up-to-date on all activities. I
am also forwarding a copy of this letter to Ken, and
if he has any further suggestions, I am sure you will
hear from him*
Art Hungerford asked me to include with this letter
the following information and attached enclosures;
”1 find no place where it is proposed to set up a non¬
commercial inner-city radio station* Maybe Ken has
some information. I assume you’ve read NYT on Col¬
umbia Workshop, but here’s a carbon copy anyway.
Talked to Erik Barnouw* He knew of Dr* Sol Worth
at Annenberg School, University of Pennsylvania,
Philadelphia, who has been showing disadvantaged kids
how to make films. There is also a similar film unit
functioning in NYC under Deputy Mayor Costello and
uses facilities of WNYCj Sy Siegal, 2500 Municipal
Bldg., HYC, 10007, would know.
Also enclosed is flyer on Roger Penn’s trail-biasing
effort here. He’s the finest; sincere and dedicated
to a good cause. Certainly you want to see his work¬
shop in August. I’m sure, also that John Taylor in
Chicago would be a gold mine of information.
Does any of this help?"
I will continue to mail you pertinent information
that may be helpful to you as I become aware of it.
Good luck!
Sincerely,
ccs Mr. Ken Clark
Mr. Art Hungerford
Lucinda K. Landreth
Administrative Assistant
